main event: A witness in Cleveland, Ohio observed a strange object in the sky on December 27, 1954.
interesting points: The object was visible for a short time only and did not operate in an unusual manner.
The object would disappear and reappear, which is indicative of an astronomical phenomenon such as a star, planet or meteor.
The object was described as a luminescent white to yellow object, the size of a small aircraft.
The witness estimated the object to be extremely small, less than 1/4 the size of a matchstick head when held at arm's length.
There were 5 or 6 silvery, glowing objects that were moving fast and erratically, seemingly catching fire at a high altitude.
sighted object: a luminous white/yellow object, 5-6 silvery glowing objects
